results.title: Finding Will
results.creator_credit: Kym Levett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As the keeper of historical artifacts for his family, Kym Levett recently visited the parts of France that were battlefields during the Great War. He took his two sons and his mission is to find the remains of his great, great Uncle Will Cundy who had died fighting during the war. This is a story of the journey to bring Private William Cundy home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kym Levett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Dots and dashes
results.creator_credit: Jacob Romeril, Kevin Coughlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Catching mumps just before his 18th birthday prevented Kevin Coughlin from joining the RAAF during the second World War. But thanks to his connections, he was able to get work as a Wireless Telegraphist. In the end, Kevin ended up with skills that made him unique. Naturally left handed, he was forced to tap out morse code with his right hand. This afforded him a dexterity that meant he could do morse code with his right hand and write with his left which made him invaluable. He tells of his time in Darwin and, later, on Peron Island in the Timor Sea.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacob Romeril, Kevin Coughlin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

This afforded him a dexterity that meant he could do morse code with his right hand and write with his left which made him invaluable. He tells of his time in Darwin and, later, on Peron Island in the Timor Sea.

results.title: In our words: stories from Victorian veterans [April 2010]
results.creator_credit: Reginald Relf, Ralph Basson, John Vincent, Jack Holdsworth, Hugh Melville, Grant Coultman-Smith, Gordon White, Con Bell, Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine Victorian war veterans tell of their service during various wars for Australia. Covering World War II and the Vietnam War, these men share their experiences, joys and traumas of this time that would shape the rest of their lives. Created as part of ‘In our words : stories from Victorian veterans’ Digital Storytelling project at ACMI.

Covering World War II and the Vietnam War, these men share their experiences, joys and traumas of this time that would shape the rest of their lives. Created as part of ‘In our words : stories from Victorian veterans’ Digital Storytelling project at ACMI.

results.title: [Reginald Relf]
results.creator_credit: Reginald Relf, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Reginald Relf tells of his time in the Royal Australian Air Force, training as a mechanic at RMIT in Melbourne. Later he was posted in Queensland, tracking aircraft flying to and from New Guinea. As well as sharing his experiences of this time, he tells of his joy and relief when war ended.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reginald Relf, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Traditions
results.creator_credit: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Conscription brought Con Bell into World War II. Regardless of how he entered the war, Con is proud of the part he played in the development of a new army tradition. A member of the first permanent commando squadrons, he reflects on how this experience has shaped the man he is today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Con Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Persevere
results.creator_credit: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Soon after landing in South Vietnam, John Vincent was sent to Pleiku to serve as a Platoon Commander. In telling of his time in Pleiku, John considers the cultural assumptions he made and the importance of his training in military action.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Vincent, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: One of thousands
results.creator_credit: Ralph Basson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Basson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: As a veteran who served in Normandy during World War II, Ralph Basson takes us on a sensory tour of war. In this, Ralph highlights the things you cling to in order to survive. ‘With all the chaos going on around you, you have to remember your training and just put one foot in front of the other’.

results.title: Inspired by veterans
results.creator_credit: Hugh Melville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: So keen was Hugh Melville to join his older brother in the second world war, that he deliberately failed first year Medicine to achieve his goal. While Hugh travelled extensively and fought in different countries, it was the men he fought with that were an inspiration to him, back then and for the rest of his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh Melville, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: So keen was Hugh Melville to join his older brother in the second world war, that he deliberately failed first year Medicine to achieve his goal. results.title: Homecoming
results.creator_credit: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. Rejected by the people, the Returned Services League and even the Government, Grant and his colleagues found comfort and support in each other as they fought the psychological effects of war and achieving greater recognition for their service in the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grant Coultman-Smith, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Despite the horrors of fighting in the Vietnam War, Grant Coultman-Smith and his fellow soldiers were unprepared for the reception when they returned to Australia. results.title: Freedom
results.creator_credit: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war. Travelling through Normandy, he was surprised and amazed at the appreciation shown by the local people whose freedom he and his fellow soldiers had helped protect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Gatherum, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: During his trip back to Normandy on the 65th anniversary of D-day, Bob Gatherum reflects on the lasting legacy of war.
